intro: Glischrocaryon behrii, commonly known as the Cape daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are yellow with a white center. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
